statement.tex:
\text{Discuss the continuity of the function f,\\ where f is defined by }\\
f(x) = \begin{cases} -2, &if &x \leq -1\\ 2x,&if & -1\lt x\leq 1 \\ 2, &if &x>1 \end{cases}

step.tex: f(x) \text{ is a straight line for }x\ne -1,1.\\ \text{Hence, it is continuous for all }x\neq -1,1.\\ \text{But we need to check for continuity \\ at x=-1,1.}
step.reason: \text{Since, at} x=-1,1\text{the definition of the\\ function changes. So, x=-1,1 are the\\ only problem points.hence, we need\\ to check continuity at x=-1,1.}

step.tex:
\lim_{x\to -1^-}f(x) = -2\\ \lim_{x\to -1^+}f(x) = \lim_{x\to -1^+} (2x) =-2 \\ f(1)=-2\\
\lim_{x\to 1^-}f(x) = \lim_{x\to 1^-} (2x) =2\\ \lim_{x\to 1^+}f(x) = 2 \\ f(1)=2\\ \\ \text{Hence, f(x) is discontinuous at x=1.}\\
step.reason: \text{Since, f(x) is continuous at }x \neq -1,1\text{(step2)}\\ \text{So,x=-1,1 is the only point of discontinuity}\\
